metadata.title: CVE-2017-11462 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers tohave unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion ofsecurity contexts on error.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.15.2-1
krb5-gss-samples - 1.15.2-1
krb5-k5tls - 1.15.2-1
krb5-kdc - 1.15.2-1
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.15.2-1
krb5-kpropd - 1.15.2-1
krb5-locales - 1.15.2-1
krb5-multidev - 1.15.2-1
krb5-otp - 1.15.2-1
krb5-pkinit - 1.15.2-1
krb5-user - 1.15.2-1
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.15.2-1
libgssrpc4 - 1.15.2-1
libk5crypto3 - 1.15.2-1
libkadm5clnt-mit11 - 1.15.2-1
libkadm5srv-mit11 - 1.15.2-1
libkdb5-8 - 1.15.2-1
libkrad0 - 1.15.2-1
libkrb5-3 - 1.15.2-1
libkrb5support0 - 1.15.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.15.2-1').
